Line 172: Line 172:
==Copyright holders==
==Copyright holders==
â
The text of the GPL is itself copyrighted, and the copyright is held by the Free Software Foundation. However, the FSF does not hold the copyright for a work released under the GPL, unless an author explicitly [[Copyright assignment|assigns copyrights]] to the FSF (which seldom happens except for programs that are part of the GNU project). Only the individual copyright holders have the authority to sue when a license violation takes place.
+
The text of the GPL is itself [[copyright]]ed, and the copyright is held by the Free Software Foundation. However, the FSF does not hold the copyright for a work released under the GPL, unless an author explicitly [[Copyright assignment|assigns copyrights]] to the FSF (which seldom happens except for programs that are part of the GNU project). Only the individual copyright holders have the authority to sue when a license violation takes place.
â
The FSF permits people to create new licenses based on the GPL, as long as the derived licenses do not use the GPL preamble without permission. This is discouraged, however, since such a license is generally incompatible with the GPL.<ref>{{cite web
+
The FSF permits people to create new licenses based on the GPL, as long as the derived licenses do not use the GPL preamble without permission. This is discouraged, however, since such a license is might be incompatible with the GPL.<ref>{{cite web
|url=http://www.fsf.org/licensing/licenses/gpl-faq.html#ModifyGPL
|url=http://www.fsf.org/licensing/licenses/gpl-faq.html#ModifyGPL
|title=GPL FAQ: Can I modify the GPL and make a modified license?
|title=GPL FAQ: Can I modify the GPL and make a modified license?
â
}}</ref> (See the [http://www.fsf.org/licenses/gpl-faq.html#ModifyGPL GPL FAQ] for more information.) It also causes [[license proliferation]].
+
}}</ref> and causes a perceived [[license proliferation]].
Other licenses created by the GNU project include the [[GNU Lesser General Public License]] and the [[GNU Free Documentation License]].
Other licenses created by the GNU project include the [[GNU Lesser General Public License]] and the [[GNU Free Documentation License]].
